column2: Cultivate is a labor of love and intention. Kamaria Weems (they/them) and Janhavi Madabushi (xie/they) are queer and trans people of color living in the Boston metro area creating offerings for QTPOC to circle up and share healing practices.

The Boston Abortion Support Collective provides free, compassionate and empowering support to people experiencing abortion. We provide physical, emotional, spiritual and informational support for people throughout the full spectrum of reproductive experiences, with a focus on abortion and pregnancy loss. POC lead and centered.

Volunteer LGBTQ speakers bureau creating change through personal stories

Lotux hopes to merge the worlds of drag and organizing by organizing in drag. Lotux is a collective of AAPI Drag artists dedicated in the fight for social justice. We aim to create social change through workshops, discussions, performances, and organizing. You do not need to have prior experience to engage and/or join. This is a space that is open for folks to experiment with the art of drag, as well as cultivate and hone their art.

The Theater Offensive’s Mission is to present the diversity of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender lives in art so bold it breaks through personal isolation, challenges the status quo, and builds thriving communities.

Voices Rising is a women's chorus, founded upon feminist principles of community, inclusivity, activism and education. We sing together to give voice to our lives, identities and beliefs, and to celebrate the diverse lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and women's communities in and around Boston. Raising our voices in joy and solidarity, we contribute to the growing tradition of the women's choral movement. Through our music, we strengthen ourselves and serve our community's history, present needs and future possibilities.

Queer Soup specializes in developing new works by local artists. In addition to stage plays, we collaborate on projects with local LGBTQ youth organizations and donate part of every show’s profits to a local non-profit. Queer Soup’s mission is to create original work that pushes the boundaries of theater, to inspire open dialogue and change. We have been performing throughout New England for the last 12 years, empowering audiences to discover truth in their identity.

column1: The Boston Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence
column2:
We are the sacred clowns of our community, taking a stand on the edge of what our society defines as “normal”. All of those who walk beside us are by default closer to the center of the tent of inclusion.

You may be male, female, transgender, or intersex. You may be straight, gay/lesbian, bisexual, queer, or questioning. You may prefer wearing suits or dresses, leather or lace, or nothing at all. You may enjoy baking or boxing, kitsch or kink.
